humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the maximum dimension of the invasive component of the tumor, which is 1.1 cm. This is smaller than the 2 cm threshold for T2 tumors, so the tumor is not a T2, T3, or T4 tumor. The report does not indicate any direct extension to the chest wall or skin, so the tumor is not a T4 tumor. Therefore, the tumor is a T1 tumor. The specific T1 substage (T1a, T1b, T1c) is provided in the report as pT1c, so the T stage is T1c.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, it is mentioned that the size of the tumor is 1.1 cm in diameter. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T1.
